topic.title: Power and Reference Pins

row.entry: +0.82 V Core Supply Voltage These pins provide power to the digital core. The device power pins must be connected to a well-decoupled digital power supply.

entry.p: These pins source the switch analog clock synthesis. These pins must be connected to the filtering circuit provided in the power filtering section.
These pins source the switch analog clock synthesis. These pins must be connected to the filtering circuit provided in the power filtering section.
This supply can be connected to a 1 V regulator for extended transmit swing. If a 1 V regulator is used, both AVD_0V8_CSU_* and AVD_0V8_PCIE_VDDIO balls must be powered to 1V.

p.b: +0.82/+1.00 V Analog PCIe Transmit Supply Voltage

entry.p: These pins source the switch transmit analog PCIe circuitry. These pins must be connected to the filtering circuit provided in the power filtering section.
This supply can be connected to a 1 V regulator for extended transmit swing. If a 1 V regulator is used, both AVD_0V8_CSU_* and AVD_0V8_PCIE_VDDIO balls must be powered to 1 V.
These pins source the switch analog PCIe circuitry. These pins must be connected to the filtering circuit provided in the power filtering section.

note.p: VDDSVS is now tied internally in the substrate to VDDIO so these pins are left floating for backwards compatibility to RevA ball map.

entry.p: These pins source the switch analog clock synthesis. These pins must be connected to the filtering circuit provided in the power filtering section.

p.b: +1.80 V Analog PCIe Quiet Supply Voltage

entry.p: These pins source the switch analog quiet PCIe circuitry. These pins must be connected to the filtering circuit provided in the power filtering section.
These pins source the switch analog quiet PCIe circuitry. These pins must be connected to the filtering circuit provided in the power filtering section.
The digital output buffer supply pin(s) must be connected to a well-decoupled digital power supply.

p.b: Not connected to power or ground

entry.p: These pins are connected to the matching AVD_1V8_PCIE_Q balls via a 0.1uF capacitor.
Do NOT connect these pins to VSS or Power. More details are provided in the power filtering section.
These pins must be connected through a Confirmed that 536 and 523 are both valid values523 Ω 1% resistor to the corresponding PLL_REF_RETURN as follows:

note.p: For 85-Ω-diff impedance, use Rext = 950.815 Ω. PCIe 2.0 expects 85-Ω-diff PCB/package/termination impedance, whereas most other standards expect 100-Ω-diff impedance.

row.entry: +1.80 V Digital Supply Voltage This pin must be connected to a 1.8 V supply with an option to connect to Ground.
Supply Ground The device ground pin(s) must be connected to the digital ground of the digital power supply.
